analyzed: vegavati svāhā
translated: To the swift one, svāhā.

analyzed: om svāhā
translated: To Om, svāhā.

original: sarvatathāgatamūrte pravaravigate vigatabhayasva me bhagavati sarvapāpasvastirbhavatu mama sarvasattvānāñca svāhā /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata mūrte pravara vigate vigata bhaya sva me bhagavati sarva pāpa svastiḥ bhavatu mama sarva sattvānām ca svāhā
translated: To the embodiment of all tathāgatas, to the supreme one, to the one free from fear, be my blessed one, may there be well-being from all evil for me and all beings, svāhā.

original: om munimuni vimunivimuni dharidhari caricari valane bhagavati bhayaharaṇibhayaharaṇi bodhibodhi bodhayabodhaya budhiribudhiri cuṃbilicuṃbili
analyzed: om muni muni vimuni vimuni dharidhari caricari valane bhagavati bhaya haraṇi bhaya haraṇi bodhi bodhi bodhaya bodhaya budhiri budhiri cuṃbili cuṃbili
translated: Om Muni Muni Vimi Muni Vimi Dhari Dhari Chari Chari Valane Bhagawati Bhaya Harani Bhaya Harani Bodhi Bodhi Bodhaya Bodhaya Budhiri Budhiri Chumbili Chumbili

analyzed: svāhā
translated: Svāhā.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata hṛdaya juṣṭe svāhā
translated: Oṃ, you who are in the heart of all tathāgatas, svāhā!

original: om munimuni munivare abhiṣiñca māṃ saparivāraṃ sarvasattvānāñca sarvatathāgatāḥ sarvavidyābhiṣekairmahākavacamudrāmudritaiḥ sarvatathāgatahṛdayādhiṣṭhitaśuddhe
analyzed: om muni muni muni vare abhiṣiñca mām sa parivāram sarva sattvānām ca sarva tathāgatāḥ sarva vidyā abhiṣekaiḥ mahā kavaca mudrā mudritaiḥ sarva tathāgata hṛdaya dhiṣṭhita śuddhe
translated: Oṃ, Muni, Muni, in the excellent Muni, consecrate me and my retinue, and all beings, with the consecrations of all tathāgatas and all vidyās, sealed with the great armor, established in the pure mudrā of the heart of all tathāgatas,

analyzed: mudre vajre svāhā
translated: Mudrā, Vajra, Svāhā!
The great dhāraṇī of the invincible Mahāmudrā-heart, the wish-fulfilling jewel, radiating with the purity of the surrounding garland of flames,

analyzed: punar evam apara mantrāḥ siddhāḥ sarva karma karāḥ śubhāḥ
translated: Again, these other mantras are accomplished, performing all actions, auspicious,

analyzed: sarva kāmaṃdadā bhadra āsyam prabhāṣe śṛṇuṣva ca
translated: Giving all desires, auspicious, speak! Listen!

original: tadyathā om amṛtavare varavara pravara viśuddhe hūṃhūṃ phaṭphaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: tat yathā om amṛta vare vara vara pravara viśuddhe hūṃ hūm phaṭ phaṭ svāhā
translated: Namely, Oṃ, O you of the excellent boon of nectar, the boon of boons, the pure one, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā!

original: om amṛtavilokini garbha saṃrakṣaṇi ākarṣaṇi hūṃ hūṃ phaṭphaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om amṛtavilokini garbha saṃrakṣaṇi ākarṣaṇi hūm hūm phaṭ phaṭ svāhā
translated: Oṃ, O you who observe the nectar, who protect the embryo, who attract, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā!

analyzed: aparājitā hṛdayam
translated: The heart of the invincible one.🔽 Oṃ, O stainless one, O vast one, O excellent victory, O you who carry victory, O you who are pure with nectar, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā!🔽 Here is the text with the alignment mistakes fixed and the English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:

original: om vimale vipule jayavare jayavāhini amṛtaviraje hūṃ hūṃ phaṭphaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om vimale vipule jayavare jayavāhini amṛtaviraje hūm hūm phaṭ phaṭ svāhā
translated: Oṃ, O you who are pure, O you who are vast, O you who are the excellent victory, O you who carry victory, O you who are pure with nectar, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā!🔽 Here is the text with the alignment mistakes fixed and the English translations updated to match the Sanskrit:

original: om bharabhara saṃbharasaṃbhara indriye balaviśodhani hūṃ hūṃ phaṭphaṭru ru cale svāhā /
analyzed: om bhara bhara saṃbhara saṃbhara indriye bala viśodhane hūm   phaṭ phaṭ ru ru cale svāhā
translated: Om Bharabhara Sambharasambhara Indriye Balavisodhani Hum Hum Phat Phat Ru Chale Svaha.

original: om maṇidhari vajriṇi mahāpratisare hūṃ hūṃ phaṭphaṭ svāhā /
analyzed: om maṇidhari vajriṇi mahāpratisare hūm hūm phaṭ phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om Manidhari Vajrini Mahapratisara Hum Hum Phat Phat Svaha.

analyzed: upahṛdaya vidyā
translated: The Upadharma Vidya.

analyzed: asyāḥ śravaṇa mātreṇa sarva pāpa kṣayaṃgatā
translated: Merely by hearing this, all sins are destroyed.

original: yayā yukto vajrakāyo namastasyai namo namaḥ //
analyzed: yayā yuktaḥ vajra kāyaḥ namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To whomsoever this is given, his body becomes like a vajra. Salutations to her, again and again.

analyzed: yān smaran rāhulaḥ rakṣa mātaram kukṣi saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Remembering her, Rahula was protected while staying in his mother's womb.

original: prakṣipte yo viṣanadyāṃ namastasyai namo namaḥ //
analyzed: prakṣipte yaḥ viṣa nadyām namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: When he was thrown into the poison river, he was not harmed. Salutations to her, again and again.

analyzed: yaḥ rakṣet vaṇijaḥ putram krūra sarpa vadha udyatam
translated: She who protected the merchant's son from being killed by a fierce snake,

analyzed: viṣa dā aham u ṣaḥ ca namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: and also from the burning poison, salutations to her, again and again.

analyzed: brahmadattaḥ mahā rājaḥ yayā rakṣitam aṣṭakaḥ
translated: The great king Brahmadatta was protected by her, as well as Ashtaka.

analyzed: ripum jitvā virājaḥ bhūt namaḥ tasyai manaḥ sadā
translated: Having conquered his enemies, he became prosperous. Salutations to her, always.

analyzed: bhikṣu duḥśīlakaḥ rogī yayā kaṇṭhe prabandhitaḥ
translated: The monk who was immoral and sick, she who was tied around his neck,

original: prāṇāmukto yayai svargaṃ namastasyai namo namaḥ //
analyzed: prāṇa āmuktaḥ yayai svargam namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: by whom he was released from his life and went to heaven, salutations to her, again and again.

analyzed: samudre pota saṃkṣubdhe vaṇijān prāṇa rakṣakaḥ
translated: When the ship was wrecked in the ocean, she who protected the merchants and their lives,

analyzed: yām smaran sārthavāhaḥ bhūt namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Remembering which, he became the caravan leader. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: yayā pratibaddhāyām bhāryāyām sutam āptavān
translated: By whom, when bound to his wife, he obtained a son.

analyzed: prasārita bhujaḥ rājā namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: The king, with outstretched arms, made offerings. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: pratismṛtvā dīnāram pradadau jine
translated: Remembering whom, the poor one gave a dīnāra to the Jina.

analyzed: rājā ajiṣṭa pradātā abhūt namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: The king became the giver of what is desired. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: yām prabuddha asuraiḥ baddhaḥ cūḍāmaṇau prabhuḥ
translated: By whom, when bound by the awakened asuras in the crest jewel,

analyzed: labdhavān vijayam vajrī namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: The lord of the Vajra obtained victory. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: pūrya
translated: By whom, with the power of the Avantī army alone, the six perfections were fulfilled,

original: mārāñjitvā jinā buddhā namastasyai namo namaḥ //
analyzed: mārān jitvā jināḥ buddhāḥ namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: The victorious Buddhas conquered Māra. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: aparādhī vadha arhaḥ api prakṣiptaḥ sarva saṃkaṭe
translated: Even though guilty and deserving of death, thrown into all danger,

analyzed: yām smṛtaḥ parimuktaḥ abhūt namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Remembering whom, he was released. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: yayā bandhita kaṇṭhaḥ ca mukta upāya saṃkaṭāt
translated: By whom, with the throat bound, he was released from the danger of means,

analyzed: nagare nāyakaḥ bhūt namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: The leader became in the city. Salutations to her, again and again!

analyzed: yā ca aparājitā avijyā ādyā
translated: And the Aparājitā spell, which

analyzed: sarva buddhaiḥ ca dhāritā
translated: is held by all the Buddhas,

analyzed: mudritā bhāṣitā nityam paṭhitā para deśitā
translated: is always sealed, spoken, recited, and taught by others,

analyzed: likhitā moditā sattva hitāya pūjitā sadā
translated: Written, recited, and always worshipped for the benefit of beings,

original: smṛtvā kāyagatāṃ kṛtvā namastasyai namo namaḥ //
analyzed: smṛtvā kāya gatām kṛtvā namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Remembering and keeping it in the body, I pay homage to it again and again.

analyzed: yasyāḥ śravaṇa mātram ca bhuvanatraye
translated: Whose mere hearing is difficult to obtain in the three worlds,

analyzed: pāṭha svādhyayanam vā api namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Even reciting and studying it, I pay homage to it again and again.

analyzed: yā vidyā durlabhā buddhaiḥ vyākṛtā saṃpraśaṃsitā
translated: That knowledge which is difficult to obtain even for the Buddhas, which is prophesied and praised,

analyzed: mahatī dhāraṇī khyātā sarva pāpa kṣayaṃkarī
translated: The great dhāraṇī that is renowned, which destroys all evil.
Of great power, great serpents, great splendor, great light,
The knowledge of great qualities, which shatters all demons,
Which opens the knot of evil, which liberates from the arrogance of Māra,

analyzed: jananī bodhisattvānām sarva duṣṭa vināśinī
translated: The mother of bodhisattvas, which destroys all evil,

analyzed: rakṣiṇī poṣiṇī dhātrī para mantra vighāṭinī
translated: Which protects, nourishes, and nurtures, which obstructs the supreme mantra,

analyzed: vidhvaṃsana karī śivā
translated: Which pacifies the destructive yogas of Kākhorda and others,

original: mahāyānaratānāñca gṛhṇatāṃ likhatāṃ tathā /🔽pāṭhādhyayanakṛtāṃ nityaṃ dadhatāṃ śrūyatāṃ tathā //
analyzed: mahāyāna ratānām ca gṛhṇatām likhatām tathā  pāṭha adhyayana kṛtām nityam dadhatām śrūyatām tathā
translated: And for those who delight in the Mahāyāna, who receive it and write it,🔽Who always recite and study it, who remember it and listen to it,

original: parebhyo diśatāṃ caiva nityaṃ manasi bhāvitām /
analyzed: parebhyaḥ diśatām ca eva nityam manasi bhāvitām
translated: And who always bestow it upon others, which is always kept in mind,

analyzed: sa pustaka gatām kṛtvā pūjya mānya namaskṛtam
translated: Having made it into a book, it is worshipped, bowed to,

analyzed: sarva pāpa harī bhadrā bodhi saṃbhāra pūraṇī
translated: The auspicious remover of all sins, fulfiller of the requisites for enlightenment.

analyzed: namaḥ tasyai namaḥ tasyai namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to her, salutations to her, salutations to her, salutations again and again.

analyzed: yasyāḥ mantra prabhāveṇa sarva bhaye upadravāḥ
translated: By the power of whose mantra, all fears, calamities,

original: duṣṭāsuramanuṣyāśca daityagandharvarākṣasāḥ //🔽grahāḥ skaṃdā apasmārāḥ piśācā yakṣakinnarāḥ /
analyzed: duṣṭa asura manuṣyāḥ ca daitya gandharva rākṣasāḥ  grahāḥ skaṃdāḥ apasmārāḥ piśācāḥ yakṣa kinnarāḥ
translated: Evil demons, humans, daityas, gandharvas, rakshasas,🔽Planets, skandas, epilepsy, pisachas, yakshas, kinnaras,

original: ḍākinyaḥ śākinīsaṃghā nāgāḥ kāṣordda tu vyādhayaḥ /
analyzed: ḍākinyaḥ śākinī saṃghāḥ nāgāḥ tu vyādhayaḥ
translated: Dakinis, groups of shakinis, nagas, leprosy, diseases,

analyzed: jvarāḥ ca vividhāḥ rogāḥ para karma kṛtāḥ tathā
translated: And various fevers and illnesses caused by others,

analyzed: viṣa agni śastra mantrāṇi vidyutaḥ kāla bādhayaḥ
translated: Poisons, fire, weapons, mantras, lightning, untimely death,

analyzed: ati vṛṣṭiḥ anāvṛṣṭiḥ sarva śatru bhayāni ca
translated: Excessive rain, drought, and all enemy fears,

analyzed: tathā anye pi upasargāḥ vā vinaśyanti na saṃśayaḥ
translated: And other calamities are destroyed without a doubt.

analyzed: sarva kāryāṇi namaḥ tasyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: All endeavors are successful, salutations to her, salutations again and again.

original: yaśca tāṃ dhārayet vidyāṃ kaṇṭhe vāhau ca mastake /
analyzed: yaḥ ca tām dhārayet vidyām kaṇṭhe vāhau ca mastake
translated: One who wears that knowledge on the throat, arms, and head,

analyzed: nityam rakṣanti devāḥ tam daityāḥ nāgāḥ ca mānuṣāḥ
translated: Is always protected by gods, demons, nagas, and humans.

analyzed: gandharvāḥ kinnarāḥ yakṣāḥ bhūta preta piśācakāḥ
translated: Gandharvas, kinnaras, yakshas, ghosts, pretas, and pisachas,

analyzed: ḍākinyaḥ rākṣasādūtyaḥ kumbhāṇḍāḥ kaṭapūtanāḥ
translated: Dākinīs, Rākṣasīs, Kumbhāṇḍas, and Kaṭapūtanās,

original: trisandhyaṃ yaḥ paṭhet nityaṃ buddhārakṣanti taṃ sadā /
analyzed: trisandhyam yaḥ paṭhet nityam buddhāḥ ārakṣanti tam sadā
translated: He who recites this always at the three junctions, the Buddhas always protect him.

analyzed: pratyekāḥ śrāvakāḥ ca eva bodhisattvāḥ maharddhikāḥ
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas and the Śrāvakas, and the Bodhisattvas of great spiritual power,

analyzed: yoginaḥ siddha mantrāḥ ca mahā vīrya mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: The yogis and the accomplished mantra-holders, the greatly valiant and great sages,

analyzed: vajrapāṇiḥ ca yakṣa indraḥ śakraḥ ca tridaśaiḥ saha
translated: And Vajrapāṇi, the lord of Yakṣas, and Śakra with the thirty gods,

analyzed: catvāraḥ ca mahā rājāḥ brahmā viṣṇuḥ maheśvara
translated: And the Four Great Kings, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and Maheśvara,
Nandikeśa, Mahākāla, Kārttikeya, Gaṇeśvara,

analyzed: bhairavāḥ mātṛkāḥ durgāḥ tathā anye māra kāyikāḥ
translated: The Bhairavas, the Mātṛkās, Durgā, and others of the Māra class,

analyzed: vidyā devyaḥ mahā vīryāḥ mahā bala parākramāḥ
translated: The Vidyā goddesses of great spiritual power, of great strength and valor,
Māmakī, Bhṛkuṭī, Tārā, Aṅkuśī, Vajraśṛṅkhalā,
Mahāśvetā, Mahākālī, Vajradūtī, and Upāśikā,
Vajra-mālā, the great knowledge, of great spiritual power, the immortal Kuṇḍalī,
Vajrāpराजिता, Caṇḍī, Kālakarṇī, of great strength,

analyzed: tathā dhanyā mahābhāgā padma kuṇḍaliḥ eva ca
translated: And likewise, the blessed one, the greatly fortunate one, and Padmakuṇḍalī,
Maṇicūḍā, Puṣpadantī, Svarṇakeśī, and Piṅgalā,
Ekajatā, Mahādevī, Dhanyā, Vidyutsumālinī,

analyzed: kapālinī ca raṃ laṃ
translated: Kapālinī, Raṃlaṃ,

analyzed: keśī kṣudrākṣī iti eka nāyikā
translated: Keśī, Kṣudrāksī, Ekana-yikā,

analyzed: hārī iti pāñcikā ca eva śaṃkhinī kūṭa dantinī
translated: Hāri, Pāñcikā, Śaṅkhinī, Kūṭadanti-nī,

analyzed: śrī sarasvatī lakṣmīḥ siddheśvarī sadānugā
translated: Śrī Sarasvatī, Lakṣmī, Siddheśvarī, Sadānuga,

original: tamevānye 'pi rakṣanti yasya vidyā kare sthitā /
analyzed: tam eva anye rakṣanti yasya vidyā kare sthitā
translated: Those who have this Vidyā in their hands, they protect him.

analyzed: sa bhavet sarva sattvānām mokṣaṇa artham samudyataḥ
translated: He becomes engaged in the liberation of all beings.

analyzed: rājānaḥ vaśa gāḥ tasya puṇya rāśim vivardhayet
translated: Kings come under his control, and he increases his store of merit.

analyzed: siddhayante sarva kalpāḥ ca praviṣṭaḥ jina mandire
translated: All his wishes are fulfilled, and he enters the Jina's abode.

analyzed: ante bauddha padam yāyāt jinasya vacanam yathā
translated: In the end, he goes to the Buddha's state, just as the Jina has said.

original: yā strī dhārayed vidyāṃ prasūyedgurviṇī sukham //
analyzed: yā strī dhārayet vidyām prasūyet gurviṇī sukham
translated: The woman who bears this Vidyā gives birth to a child happily while pregnant.

analyzed: aputrā labhate putram vyādhi muktā sukha āśinī
translated: She who is childless obtains a son, is free from disease, and eats happily.

analyzed: dhana dhānyaiḥ varaiḥ yuktā mānanīyā priyaṃvadā
translated: Endowed with wealth, grain, and excellent things, she is respected and speaks pleasantly.

analyzed: susvapnānām satya karī jinakṣetram samāpnuyāt
translated: She makes true the good dreams and attains the Buddha-field.

original: ityavocad bhagavān sā ca sarvāvatī parṣadabhyanandan // iti //
analyzed: iti avocat bhagavān sā ca sarvāvatī parṣad abhyanandan iti
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One, and the entire assembly rejoiced.

analyzed: ārya mahāpratisarāvidyādhāraṇī samāptā
translated: The noble great dhāraṇī of the knowledge of the Prajñāpāramitā is completed.
